intro: Rhetinosperma, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Rhetinosperma species are often found growing on rocky soils and in mountainous regions. The genus is characterized by its unique floral structure and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
